parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the rear brake can cause loss of control, accidents, or near-misses, especially when sudden stops are required.
symptoms: The rear brake fades or becomes inoperable
the brake pedal feels soft or spongy
the brake pedal travels further than usual
the rear brake fails to engage
the brake line is excessively hot
the rotor is cool to the touch after stopping.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Engine Stalling When Approaching a Stop
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The sudden stalling of the engine when approaching a stop can cause a loss of control, increasing the risk of accidents, especially in heavy traffic conditions.
symptoms: The engine stalls without warning when slowing down or approaching a stop sign or red light

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The engine stalling issue can cause the motorcycle to suddenly lose power, leading to a loss of control, especially when riding on the highway or in heavy traffic, which can increase the risk of accidents.
symptoms: the bike shuts down during normal driving conditions
the engine stalls when slowing down
the engine stalls when the clutch is pulled in (but not always).
